result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CM30
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Paul H Bidwell did not appear.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody at House of Corrections.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.   Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Corrections.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence as Defendant is now in custody and he needs to meet with Defendant. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a short adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court, in custody.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eryn Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
